divs: sighting detailsapproximately 12:10am, april 17, 2010. i stepped out onto my 3rd story balcony, taking a break from watching tv and to smoke a cigarette. as i glanced to the sky, nearly top center of the utmost night sky, i noticed slightly south of the center of the sky, a very large cluster of dimly lit lights(not flickering), which almost looked tiny like a flock of high-flying birds or a swarm, but very very high in the sky (above the flight pattern). i knew right away that this was a unique group of lights. i often come out very late to stargaze. this reminded me of a piece of the milky way travelling east, but not as hazey. after 10-15 seconds, realizing this group of lights weren't fading or disapating like a firework explotion, i became very excited, pleased! knocked on my sisters window, pleading with her to come out, taking my eyes off the cluster for no more than 2 seconds. i stared carefully, looking for the stars in this group to scatter or touch one another. they did not. i listened for sound, i heard nothing. there were no contrails. the group could've been a thousand planes in a group. there was no decending trajectory to indicate a falling\shooting star. they were too quick and consistent uniformity to be balloons. no erratic behavior like a flock of birds. they were moving slowly east. very dim. there must've been a thousand of them. i read in the news that we would have lights in the sky like the intense light over wisconsin. but this cluster was strange! as i said, very dim. slow moving. a bit slower than the aircraft that fly by on their eastern approach.incidently, although exceptionally higher, these lights were near the east-bound approaching flight pattern to sky harbor. the thousand or more lights did not disappear. they continued east until out of my sight. they didn't remind me of a star breaking up in the atmosphere. they were consistent in their travel. all moving together never touching one another. i called my sister out to the balcony and she saw them too. i immediately went online and emailed jim @ mufon, then stacey 2 days later.
Summary: A Cluster (1000+) of lights resembling stars travelling east travelled eastbound.
